metadata.name: Luft #26
metadata.description:
"Luft" is my latest interpretation of one of my favorite generative art patterns, Truchet tiles. Meticulously designed tiles are rotated and placed on a grid to create unexpected compositions.

Press [s] to save the image in 4096x4096 resolution.

By Roni Block
Made with p5.js
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.description:

metadata.name: Dither Creatures 2x2 #90
metadata.description:
Each creature is randomly generated using using p5js. There are 6 base colors. Rarity is determined based on the number of colors used. The most rare combination is when all 4 creatures share the same color. Roughly 1 in 216 mints should have Colors=1.

Probabilities:
Colors = 1 (.46%)
Colors = 2 (16.2%)
Colors = 3 (55.5%)
Colors = 4 (27.7%)

metadata.name: (DE)STRUCTURAL #92
metadata.description:
"Reserve a spot for your family and loved ones in our brand new *floating* high rise condominiums. Leave the dirty air of Level-1 behind! Discount of 200'000'000 credits applicable is you already own any of our apartments in another sector."

Like with my previous works, each variation starts as an empty black canvas in the depth of your [CALCULATING MACHINE]. With your [UNIQUE PURCHASE TRANSACTION RECEIPT] specially constructed AI engineers start to envision a condominium that is perfect just for you! Utilizing both the [CENTRAL PROCESSING UNIT] and [GRAPHICS PROCESSING UNIT] the blueprints materialize in front of your [ORGANS OF VISION OR OF LIGHT SENSITIVITY]. Everything is procedurally generated taking in hundreds of randomized parameters bound to specific rules of construction.

Orbit: mouse [PRIMARY] button.
Pan: mouse [SECONDARY] button.
Zoom: mouse [GYRATION DISC].
Cycle light intensity levels: [B]

metadata.name: We Are Alone Together #58
metadata.description:
We meander through the flows of life, alone but together. This experience ‚Äî an ultimately solitary one ‚Äî is communicated but never truly shared. Our consciousnesses live in a perpetual separated state, alone but together.

############

Display resolution scales with window size. Press ‚Äôh‚Äô (in live mode) to generate a 6000x7500 hi-res image. This may take a few seconds to generate depending on your hardware. Press ‚Äòd‚Äô to redraw the artwork.

Original artwork by perkwerk * made with p5.js * 2022

metadata.name: WTBS: Olympics Poster Edition #181
metadata.description:
WTBS: Olympics Poster Edition is our official collaboration with Jeres, who was kind enough to work with us in support of the show. The project leans into classic Olympic poster design motifs, embellished by Jeres' signature approach to color and shape. Huge thanks to Jeres for donating their time and enthusiasm to this one, we hope you enjoy it!

As with all WTBS projects, your minting will directly support the podcast and keep us going (and more importantly, collecting!). Our goal is to keep the show free from ads and fully supported by the community, your donations and contributions continue to make that possible. Thank you in advance to everyone who chooses to mint!

Jeres: I love vintage posters. When going to second-hand shops, flea markets or wherever people are selling their used goods, I‚Äôm always on the lookout for what people used to hang on their walls. Bauhaus-inspired posters, socialist propaganda, Nagel prints, anything art deco, etc.. but whenever I come across something Olympics inspired I always feel like I hit pay dirt. There‚Äôs something about the clean, simple design being used to show people coming together along with the undertones of human excellence that just feels special. And circles. I love circles. I hope you enjoy this collection as much as I enjoyed putting it together with Trinity and Will.

Approximate rarity notes:
5%: Gold Edition
10%: Silver Edition
15%: Bronze Edition 

Commands in fullscreen mode:
S : Save current resolution
1 : Save 2000x3000px
2 : Save 4000x6000px
3 : Save 6000x9000px
4 : Save 8000x12000px
5 : Save 10000x15000px

(The higher the resolution, the longer it takes to render/save. use Chrome for best results.)

metadata.name: Leviathan #192
metadata.description:
Leviathan is a generative collection of large bodies made form particles, materialised from the viewers own subconscious. Atoms form gargantuan objects - subatomic monoliths and microscopic giants. Playing with the sense of scale it draws on the viewer‚Äôs subjective way of associating forms, a pattern that becomes a mirror, a skeleton for them to project. 

Part artist, part viewer. Leviathan asks us to question these relationships of creation, ownership and meaning. It is a chemical reaction that the artist starts and you finish. A colossal dream we are all sharing together - a leviathan.


Controls:
s or double tap: Download image
1 : Download 2400 x 4000
2 : Download 3600 x 6000
3 : Download 4800 x 8000
4 : Download 7200 x 12000

metadata.name: Landscapes out of my mind #72
metadata.description:
In this work, the third in the series of landscapes, I tried to achieve greater realism without abandoning those elements, also characteristic of the other works, which lead out of reality such as the shapes of the ground and trees and the choice of palettes.

Lands and Clouds are rendered using a mix of simplex noise and FBM (Fractional Brownian Motion), trees are generated with space colonization algorithm an placed using Poisson Disk Sampling distribution. The distribution density is driven by the land heightmap.


Developed with three.js using WebGLRenderer.
Rendering is faster with chrome browser.


[s] to save a png at 2048x1536, 1536x2048, 2048x2048 (4/3, 3/4, 4/4 aspect ratio)
[d] to save a png at 4096x3072, 3072x4096, 4096x4096 (4/3, 3/4, 4/4 aspect ratio)


Features:
"Palette": 14 colormaps
"Aspect Ratio": 4/3, 3/4, 4/4
"View Point":  Far, Medium, Near, Above
"Sky Type": FBM, Gradient1, Gradient2
"Sky Color": LightSkyBlue, Gray, Blue [10% probability]
"Bark Color":  Brown, GrayBrown, Gray
"Bare Trees": True, False


Created by Andrea Belloni, fxhash: anbello, twitter: @Waterflowing0. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Klyft #357
metadata.description:
‚ÄúKlyft‚Äù is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel.

Klyft is a juxtaposition of two different projections for the future. One, made by the World Economic Forum, suggests that the global gender gap will have closed by the year 2154. The other, by the UN IPCC, estimates that global warming will reach 3.2 degrees celcius by the year 2100.

Klyft makes use of the unique temporal aspect of computational art by developing its expression gradually over the next 132 years. As we come closer to 2154, the space between the two shapes in Klyft will grow smaller to symbolize the closing of the gender gap. As time goes on, however, Klyft also becomes more and more glitched out to represent the projected increases in greenhouse gases and climate catastrophes.

In the end, Klyft‚Äôs expression will be heavily corrupted, and the two shapes will have reached each other.

¬∑ URL parameters ¬∑

You can add the following parameters to the URL to change the behavior of the piece.

date=<YYYY-MM-DD> ‚Äî See how Klyft looks on another day. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD. 

color=<number> ‚Äî See the piece in another color scheme. The numbers loop around, so 17 equals 0, 18 equals 1, etc. 

resolution=<number> ‚Äî View the piece in a higher resolution. 1 is normal resolution, 2 is double, etc. No decimals allowed.

image=true ‚Äî Save the piece as an image. 

record=true ‚Äî Save the piece as a video in WEBM format.

Adding the following URL parameters will show Klyft in double resolution on the day gender equality is achieved according to the WEF:

date=2154-01-01&resolution=2

Adding the following URL parameters will save a video of Klyft in the ‚ÄòStokkendahl Dalgas‚Äô color scheme:

color=14&record=true

¬∑ Interactions ¬∑

Pressing the following keys will trigger functionality as well as add related URL parameters automatically. 

Pressing D will increment the date by 1 year.

Pressing C will increment the color index by 1.

Pressing R will toggle between normal and double resolution.

Pressing I will toggle the image URL parameter, which saves the piece as an image. Only works outside of iframe.

Pressing V will toggle the video URL parameter, which saves the piece as a video. Only works outside of iframe.

There are secret key presses as well. Some of them only work outside of iframe. 

¬∑ Accessibility ¬∑

Klyft is built to support screen readers. It has been tested using MacOS‚Äô VoiceOver, and uses p5.js‚Äô describeElement() to provide screen reader functionality.

If you have any comments (good or bad) on the screen reader integration, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out on my Twitter: @ada_ada_ada_art. 

¬∑ Credits and license ¬∑

Klyft is made with p5.js.

Klyft is licensed under a modified version of the Climate Strike License (CSL).

metadata.name: üÑ∑üÑ∞-5 #33
metadata.description:
üÑ∑üÑ∞-5

Happy Accidents #5

Colourful, playful, happy.

üÑ∑üÑ∞-5 is another study of curves and bands of colour, this time also exploring mirroring and silhouettes. 

Thanks for collecting!
Click the image or press ‚Äòs‚Äô or ‚ÄòS‚Äô in live mode to download png.
DM me on twitter for a higher res file for printing \m/

Part of primary sales & secondary royalties going to Save Pakistan.

Made with p5js
¬© Happy Accidents, 2022

metadata.name: Settler #27
metadata.description:
Like first pioneers We are always set to struggle and beat many obstacles.
Often we'll fail, but in the end We will prevail.

10% of primary sales goes to the Processing Foundation @ProcessingOrg.

Thank You


Press ‚Äòs‚Äô to save canvas or ‚Äò2‚Äô for 2x and ‚Äò4‚Äô for 4x image resolution png

Created with love for p5js and generative art

@Qotonana
November, 2022.

metadata.name: Wild Matrix #66
metadata.description:
Wild Matrix art project are just patterns, all kind, created using triangles, rectangles, squares and a lot of colors :)

If you like patterns -> be wild, mint free a Wild Matrix!

25% of secondary sales goes to Proceesing Foundation (let's encourage and sustain generative art) | 25% of secondary sales goes to SavePakistan (let's help people in need). 

I would kindly appreciate a share, a follow of my Twitter or just make your mint know to others if you like it. 

‚Äì--
Maid with joy and excitment in p5js.
k@in, November 2022
CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 License

metadata.name: corrosive #4
metadata.description:
The rectangles are the generating elements, the simple shapes alternate in a game of superimpositions, lights, shadows and colors.

The corrosive texture marks the temporal dimension as the main element.

Corrosive, 2022

#Main features
- 18 ‚Äúzones‚Äù color schemes:

- 5 canvas formats;
- 7 patterns;
- 3 degrees of color saturation;
- Special features (Bubbles);

- Press ‚Äús‚Äù to save .png

Note:
- The first 3 iterations will entitle you to 1 free edition of my next project on FxHash.
- The ultra rare "PRIMARY" palette entitles you to 1 free edition of my next project on FxHash.

November 10, 2022

Generative Token by Morbeck (@morbeck_art) with support from Ot√°vio Lobato @Afestinamus for fxhash.

metadata.name: ROIL #73
metadata.description:
This space filling algorithm explores a range of abstract¬†outputs. A chaotic composition¬†is formed as it mutates and interferes with itself along the way. It finishes when the canvas has been fully covered. There¬†are¬†20 color palettes inspired by natural phenomena. It was programmed from scratch in vanilla JavaScript.

Controls
1 - Save a png
2 - Randomize
3 - Enable HD (6300x8192)

Code and Outputs are Copyright (C) 2022 Frank Force
Artwork is released under CC BY-NC 4.0

metadata.name: Lost in the attraction / abstraction #179
metadata.description:
This project is an experiment with a chaotic attractor, radial symmetry and some Perlin noise.

---
Features

Parts: the number of symmetrical parts (4|6|8|10)

Palette: the palette chosen to draw the sketch

Attractors incrementation: a number between 0.0013 and 0.003 which will increment the parameters (a, b, c & d) of an attractor (Clifford A. Pickover).

---
Resolutions & controls

By default the work is drawn on a canvas of 1280 x 1280 pixels but you can double or triple this resolution, for this in live mode add to the URL &scale= with the desired factor.

You can also download an image (PNG) by pressing [d] key.


---
This artwork celebrate the first anniversary of FxHash, 50% of the proceeds will go to the Processing Foundation.


Created with typescript and simplex-noise (npm package). 

Artwork by Nicolas Lebrun / @nclslbn / https://nicolas-lebrun.fr/contact/

metadata.name: Annum #4821
metadata.description:
This project is being released in celebration of the 1 year aniversary of Achromat, my first release on fxhash. In addition to being inspired by Achromat, aspects of other previous projects have been incorporated. My deepest gratitude to all who have collected my work over the past year.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

50% of primary sales go to Savepakistan.

metadata.name: fx(mandala) #84
metadata.description:
Outer mandalas represent the universe or world-system and are traditionally offered as thank you gifts. In this case it‚Äôs my offering to the fxhash community as a celebration of #fxhashturnsone. 

SOME MINTS WILL BE GOLDEN TICKETS
A golden ticket AND the iteration directly before it will each receive a free 8 x 10in special edition signed physical made from 12 layers of laser cut museum board. 

Physicals for all mints can be requested and/or claimed at https://alleditions.art

Outer Mandalas is part of a broader series I am working on that explores the use of techniques and patterns from sacred geometries using generative randomness. I use generative algorithms to create ‚Äúblueprints‚Äù that can be transferred out of the physical realm and into the real world as multi-layered three dimensional sculptures. 

I create limited edition physical ‚Äúprints‚Äù for Outer Mandalas by using a high powered laser to precisely cut through 4-ply museum boards (the same stuff you frame a picture with) to create 12 unique layers. I then stack and carefully glue each layer together in order to create a dynamic relief that plays with light and shadow. These pieces are visually engaging artworks that tend to spark conversation whenever they are seen.  

A big thank you to the fxhash platform team and all the passionate collectors and generative artists I‚Äôve met over the past year. It‚Äôs been my honor to be a part of this amazing community. 

s to save as a layered SVG 
p to save as a PNG
e to explode the layers
Click and drag the mouse to change the shadows. 

This generative is VERY intensive and probably won‚Äôt render very well on a mobile device.
